course_title: Master of Science Psychology- Health and Wellbeing
syllabus_link: https://christuniversity.in/School of Psychological Sciences/PSYCHOLOGY/Master of Science Psychology Health and Wellbeing/syllabusstructure/5629124/2024
course_structure_link: https://christuniversity.in/School of Psychological Sciences/PSYCHOLOGY/Master of Science Psychology Health and Wellbeing/syllabusstructure/5629124/2024

fee_structure.demonstrate_domain_expertise_in_the_fiel: Demonstrate consultative decision making with empathy, clarity and comprehensiveness while respecting diversity among various stakeholders in the field of health care
Demonstrate ethical and analytical research skills and contribute to knowledge sharing among academia, clinical practitioners, researchers and general public

Demonstrate professional competencies and practise skills needed to provide psychosocial interventions focusing health and wellness in a variety of settings with an understanding of existing policies and programs

Demonstrate skills in evaluating research from a critical perspective, exhibit proficiency in evidence-based clinical practices and participate in community-oriented action research in the health sector
Recognise socio-cultural aspects in health care and treatment, from a micro and macro perspective
Demonstrate social sensitivity and leadership skills through community engagement programs

eligibility:
PO1:
Demonstrate domain expertise in the field of health and wellbeing including theoretical foundations of human behavior
PO2:
Demonstrate consultative decision making with empathy, clarity and comprehensiveness while respecting diversity among various stakeholders in the field of health care
PO3:
Demonstrate ethical and analytical research skills and contribute to knowledge sharing among academia, clinical practitioners, researchers and general public
PO4:
Demonstrate professional competencies and practise skills needed to provide psychosocial interventions focusing health and wellness in a variety of settings with an understanding of existing policies and programs
PO5:
Demonstrate skills in evaluating research from a critical perspective, exhibit proficiency in evidence-based clinical practices and participate in community-oriented action research in the health sector
PO6:
Recognise socio-cultural aspects in health care and treatment, from a micro and macro perspective
PO7:
Demonstrate social sensitivity and leadership skills through community engagement programs
why_choose: Why choose this course? Theoretical expertise in the field of health and wellbeing Expertise in ethical Skills Skills and techniques to provide psychosocial inetrventons Socio cultural understanding in health care and treatments Social sensitivity and leadership skills Expertise in analytical research skills
what_learn: What you will learn? Theoretical and research foundations, skills and techniques for understanding health, diseases and the role of a health psychologist Neurophysiological underpinnings of psychological processes of health Qualitative and quantitative research skills Human growth and development across the lifespan Common mental health issues found across populations, issues of stress and its implications for mental health as well as steps for enhancing subjective wellbeing Application of evidence-based practices in healthcare. Counselling and communication skills required while working in health care settings Public Health interventions and health management within organizations
modules: Modules Chronic Illness and management Research skills Year 1 Science of Wellbeing, Public Health Interventions, Occupational Health and Wellbeing Evidence based practices in Health Ethics in Healthcare Year 2 Clinical and counseling skills in Healthcare and Practicum Supervision
career: Career prospects Consultant Health Psychologists at hospitals, NGOs, corporations School counsellors Wellness coach/ Resilience coach/talent analyst Corporate Social Responsibility Policy makers Research (Ph.D.)/ Private researchers at different organisations
